iiv.display

Class CNUDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.CNUDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScaleInterface, ShowStatus, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class CNUDisplay
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements ShowStatus, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, ScaleInterface
    This is the primary display container window for iiV.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

      • getEventPointOnScreen

        public java.awt.Point getEventPointOnScreen(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt,
                                            boolean start)
        Gets the location of an mouse event relative to the screen based on the current drag event positioning mode. This routine is needed because this container may reposition components or itself during drag operations. Does not work on all platforms. And no way to determine which mode of operation is best for current platform.
        Parameters:
        evt - mouse event
        start - should be true if this is the initial call generated by a mouse press
        Returns:
        location of mouse event relative to the screen

      • setDrageEventPositioningMode

        Parameters:
        mode - new drag event positioing mode (EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_START_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN or EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN)
